## Task 1

1. Aesthetics being used include x, y, size, and color with variables income, life expectancy, population, and four regions mapped to such aesthetics, respectively.

2. Importing `q1data.csv` dataset:
```{python}
q1_data = pd.read_csv('/Users/donyabehroozi/Documents/gsb544/Data/q1data.csv')
print(q1_data.dtypes)
```

3. Recreating plot in Task 1: (aesthetics, geometries, scales)

```{python}
(ggplot(q1_data,
    aes(
        x = "income",
        y = "life_exp",
        size = "population",
        color = "four_regions")) +
        geom_point() +
        scale_x_continuous(trans="log2", breaks = [500, 1000, 2000, 4000, 8000, 16000, 32000, 64000], labels = [500, 1000, 2000, 4000, 8000, "16k", "32k", "64k"]) +
        scale_y_continuous(limits = (20, 90), breaks = [20,30,40,50,60,70,80,90], labels = [20,30,40,50,60,70,80,90]) +
       #scale_size_continuous()
        labs(
            x = "Income (per person GDP/capita, PPPS inflation-adjusted)",
            y = "Life expectancy (years)"
            ) +
        theme_bw() +
        scale_color_manual(
        values={
            "africa":  "#70f3ffff",
            "americas":"#54ff51ff",
            "asia":    "#ff5050ff",
            "europe":  "#fbff00ff"})
)
```
